turns.speaker: BUTCH
turns.text: Ten is standard, sir.

turns.speaker: GILLETTE
turns.text: Fine. But only if we recover the cash.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Who's that?

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: The cash we fleeced off of him was collection money. He was supposed to take that money and give it to the King earlier yesterday like he does every Thursday. 'Cept this time, he figured he could make a little something for himself off us and still get the King's money back before any body says "boo."

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: What's a King Pin?

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: Currently, the King Pin is a very large-type pole stuck up our asses.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Mob?

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: Independent. Same shit, just independent. They call him the King Pin because he looks like that guy from the comic book... Big. Fat. Bald.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: So what? We hide, right?

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: What are you? New? Let me tell you how good this guy is. Last night, Al calls this bookie to settle up. Apparently he's been ducking him for like a month. So the guy asks him where he's got all this money all of a sudden, right? What does Al do? Does he tell him that he cashed in a fucking Bar Mitzvah bond? Does he tell him he's been giving head out back for twenty bucks a pop? No... He starts going on about this job he just pulled and how he fleeced some Wall Street asshole-type... How HE fleeced.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You're pissed we didn't get credit?

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: No, that was the only semi-fucking smart thing he said! Except anybody that's ever met Big Al knows that the only thing he's comfortable doing alone is eating. This guys tells this guy, that guy tells some other guy, eventually it works it's way back to someone who works for the King and --

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: Big Al gets whacked mid-egg foo young. The whole thing took about two and a half hours. That's how good he is.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: We sure Big Al threw him to us?

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: Come on...

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: Whoa. What?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: We're going to give him the money back?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Fuck that. We're going too.

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: Alright, let's all put our dicks back in our pants for a second. Is this the best thing to do?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: This might just be me, but that is hands down, the dumbest fucking idea I've ever heard.

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: People have tried this before, Jake. It's never worked. Teddy Fraiser and his crew went on vacation in Chicago for it. Last year, Mumps got pinched in L.A.

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: The red hair... It's bad luck.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: It's not like she's a real redhead, Jake...

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: Poor bastard never knew what hit him. Jesus, I almost felt sorry for the guy.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: I gotta work off some of this adrenaline. I got a line on this Pawn Shop guy over in Brooklyn. Anybody want in?

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: Masters of our own destiny.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: So far, masters of our own demise. What bank are you with?

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: Jake...

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: It's alright. Grant's one of the good guys.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: I'm going home

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: Let's go, Jake?

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: Moonan. Here. Shit...

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: So what? We just stay clear of him.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: That's it? What are you talking about? We can still do this!

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: Jake, I mean, come on --

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I told you, use less powder.

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: But you won't get that splatter effect.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What? I can feel you looking at me.

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: That's a lot of cash. He came up with it pretty quick.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Probably some investment banker or convertible-bonds-broker-dickhead. Did you see how fast he ran out of here? It's done. He's not coming back.

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: I guess. I gotta drop a dime. Did anybody mess up the hoop?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: It can buy you a new and better you.

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: I just don't know if this says, "me". What's the fabric?

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: Seems Lionel Dolby came down with a sudden case of drowning last night. They just pulled him out of the East River.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Well, this is just fucking great...

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: It gets worse. Now I know why he was such a good rope. I mean, cash... That much and we never had to put him on the "Send?" Turns out this ducking Moe was an accountant for the King Pin.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You know what we're doing with the money.

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: And what about Big Al?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Leave him. Someone's going to find him eventually. Then they'll start looking for us, too.

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Tonight. Just me.

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: You gotta be kidding me. Her?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yes, her. Where's my wallet?

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: How much we going after?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Two million.

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: We only owe the King a hundred and fifty.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: We get fifty percent. And we get clear of the King.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: We meet him with corporate papers, inquiring about a corporate loan for start up capital. The corporate papers are in order, but we need things to happen fast. Our guy fudges numbers in the right places, moves our papers to the top of the pile or to the bottom, depending upon what we need.

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: How's that? He works for Gillette.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: We pay better.

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: Yeah... Whatever, Jake.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No, not "whatever." You're either in or you're out.

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: You laugh now, but wait until you need a clean place to powder. This is New York city, Sister. Public sanitation does not run very high on the city hall agenda. You know what you can get off a toilet or doorknob? Let's do the list... Hepatitis, influenza, the flesh eating disease --

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Here's what's going to happen. Gordo, we need to find a guy in Gillette's bank. Miles, we need papers, corporate, insurance...

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: She up for this?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: She's up for it.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: She got one leg out from under him. Now we had to lean.

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: So then Miles walks straight into the Creative Director's office and says "The code's fine, the program's for shit" and throws down like a thousand pages of code on the guy's desk!

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Uh... No thanks. I'm not going all the way to Brooklyn for a hundred dollar pay-off.

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: We're going to make it back, Grant. Three or four times over.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: And all you need to do for your ten percent is put some paperwork through and push a button tomorrow.

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: You'll be there?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Eight A.M. flight.

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: Calls?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: We'll use the Euc.

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: Jake --

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What do I always tell you guys? Don't spend it all. Sooner or later we're going to run into some bad luck. Save some. Put it away, so when shit like this happens, you're not desperate. That's it. The gig's up.

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: So that's it...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: That's it.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Then he had to bang it out across the street at the Bank of the Caymens...

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: I'd like this cashed, please.

turns.speaker: GORDO
turns.text: You ever use the bathroom in Kennedy?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What? No. Use the bathroom on the plane!

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: Grifter huh? Where have you been on the grift? Couldn't been here long 'cause I would have heard of you, Skippy.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Jake. You can call me Jake. Here and there.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: Here and there, Scooter? Here and there like Boston, Chicago, Houston? The bay area? Some action in London, 'til it turned nickel and dime. Or how about that little stint down in Miami? Heard you actually got into some trouble with the Feds down there. You guy's pretty good?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I have a good crew.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: Minus one.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Minus one.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: You know, back in the day, grafting was considered a gentleman's racket. Good suits, good food... The Underworld of the Underworld. A grifter had to survive on his wits, his instincts... I like that. I like the idea of that. These days, things being what they are, guys like me gotta stay low. It's all take, take, take. You can't just be fucking witty about it.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I guess it lacks a certain style.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: Of course, your line of work's only as good as the people you find.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You can't cheat an honest man.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: You can't cheat an honest man. But a man like Lionel Dolby...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I apologize for the inconvenience.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: Honest mistake. Just give me the money back and all will be forgiven.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I can't do that.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Let me rephrase -- I won't do that.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: Let me repeat -- Why not?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Because you killed one of my crew.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: Buddy, that was business. Besides, you have more crew. Then there's you...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'll get the money back, plus interest. I go on the grift for you. You get a cat, I get a cut. And we get square.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: Fucking grifters! I love it! You got balls, I'll give you that much.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No. Just confidence.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: I' ll be honest with you, Kid. A grifter comes in here with a fifteen hundred dollar D-K-fucking-N-Y suit, cooler than an Eskimo in winter and tells me he wants to grift for me? First thing I have to ask myself is, is he playing for me or is he just plain playing me? You tried it once.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: We got caught. So you know it won't happen again.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: You ask a lot of questions. Come on.  Let me see 'em.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I think two million.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: What do you need from me? Permission? Go! If you can fleece him for two million, then do it, Kid.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I need you to stake me.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: Stake you?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I need you to stake me. I can't do it without it. It's just a couple hundred grand. Taken out of our cut when we're done.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: That's more than you already owe me. What happens if you fuck this up?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Nothing ventured, nothing gained.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: Hey Skippy? Do I have the word "chump" tattooed on my forehead?

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: Listen, Scooter --

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No, you listen. We're partners now and even though I'm running the show for you, I'm still running the show. That means I get a little respect. So I don't want to hear anymore of this Scooter, Buddy, Junior, Skippy, Tiger, bullshit. It's Jake.  And I gotta tell you, for a guy who spends all his time in a gym, you could be in better shape.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: I said take off your fucking shirt.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: Look at you, you skinny prick.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You're not going to bust out baby oil and start rubbing me down or anything, are you?

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: Come here. Feel this.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No thanks. I'm good.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: Come here!

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: Come on. Harder.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I think I just broke my hand.

turns.speaker: KING PIN
turns.text: Harder. Remember, I killed your buddy.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What are you talking about? Ten's standard.

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: Yeah Well, Sobo's kid needs braces.

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: Don't get me wrong, Jake. I like you boys. You guys are the steadiest business in town. But what can I say? Twenty percent's still better than what we give to any of the other criminals.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: All the shit we pulled with you and you're trying to shake us down? You guys got sack.

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: Was that a threat? Did I hear a threat? Last I remember, we were talking economics, then this...? What happens next time if we gotta stop and help a little old lady cross the street? Well, shit... Then we gotta pass the call to someone else.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: That tip not work-out for you fellas?

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: Tip was fine, Jake. We were a little more curious about the Fed.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Hey, listen... If you guys don't pay your taxes, that's your business.

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: Special Agent Gunther Moonan. Ring a bell?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Gunther? I think I'd remember a Gunther.

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: Ring it for him, Sobo.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Oh yeah. Moonan. I remember now. Thanks.

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: Well he's in town and he sure as shit remembers you. What are we going to do about this Jake? We can't afford to have a Fed onto us.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Wouldn't dream of it.

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: I don't know what you're into with the King Pin, but whatever it is we get a piece, understand? We get a big piece. If we find out you're keeping us out, I may suddenly develop a conscious and give you up to Moonan myself. Say something stupid if we got a deal, Jake.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Something stupid.

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: Good boy.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Kennedy. International terminal. Gordo with a black suitcase. You got Moonan under control?

turns.speaker: ROTTOVICH
turns.text: Don't worry about Moonan. We got him covered. When...?  It was him. There's a shipment coming through tonight. Kennedy.

turns.speaker: MR. LEWIS
turns.text: Sorry, I --

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Jake. Jake Pearson. I go to lawschool with your daughter. Carolyn. We met once or twice.

turns.speaker: MR. LEWIS
turns.text: Of course. Jake. Nice to see you.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Well, it certainly is a coincidence. Here of all places! How is Mrs. Lewis?

turns.speaker: MR. LEWIS
turns.text: Great. Thank you.

turns.speaker: MR. LEWIS
turns.text: What brings you down from Boston, Jake? Taking advantage of the long weekend?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: My wife and I are just taking a little vacation.

turns.speaker: MR. LEWIS
turns.text: Attractive girl.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Thank you. Actually, it's our first anniversary this weekend. She thinks I'm here to pick up something for my mother, but it's actually a gift for her. Think I've fooled her?

turns.speaker: MR. LEWIS
turns.text: Take it from me, you never do. But congratulations. Nice to be married, isn't it?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Very much so.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Thank you, sir. You know, I hope this isn't too much of an inconvenience, but if Carolyn is coming down for the weekend, perhaps I could give you something for her? It's a check. We split the cost on a few books and I haven't had the chance to pay her back yet. Could you..?

turns.speaker: MR. LEWIS
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I lost my head. I'm... Sorry. I don't know what happened.

turns.speaker: LIONEL
turns.text: Y-y-you fucking shot him! That's what happened!

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I had to! That motherfucker was about to welch! You saw what he was doing, right? You heard him!

turns.speaker: LIONEL
turns.text: I can't be here! You understand? I can't --

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Listen to me! It went to shit. It happens sometimes.

turns.speaker: LIONEL
turns.text: Oh Jesus!

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: LISTEN to me! We don't have much time. We can still get through this but you have to keep your head and trust me!

turns.speaker: LIONEL
turns.text: What -- What do we do?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Help me.

turns.speaker: LIONEL
turns.text: What about... The money?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What about this situation makes you think I can answer that question right now?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: What is this? You guys cops or something?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: We're not cops.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: That's not --

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You interested in a little work?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Sorry about your wallet, but if you think I'm going to suck dick over thirty seven dollars, a maxed out Visa and a bad fake I.D., you're fucking crazy.  Jake.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Take a deep breath and count to ten. It's not that kind of work. You're Lily, right?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Says who?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You're working Daffy's block. He was going to break your kneecaps. Pick- pockets can be so bitchy sometimes. I told him you were with us, so that's two you owe me.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: We have work. It pays a lot. Unless you figure on getting rich lifting wallets while old guys feel you up.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Oooh. Sassy. What do you care who feels me up, Jake? Unless it kinda gotcha going. Did it, Jake? Getcha going?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Alright! Hold up. You win. You got the job.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Gee thanks. Now I don't have to find that bridge to jump off.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: We had to see what your deal was. I'm just a little superstitious.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Here's my deal -- Don't waste my time. What do you want me for anyway? You don't even know me.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I just have a good feeling about you. Haven't you ever had someone say they had a good feeling about you before?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: No.  What's my cut?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You get an equal cut.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: What do I have to do?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Just play a part. A little acting.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: What about Customs?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'll worry about Customs.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Hey, I'm not just along for the ride, so I don't want to hear any bullshit later about a smaller cut.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Take a deep breath. You sound like you just broke up with your boyfriend or something.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Mr. King, I think --

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Hey, I got it! Take some mental notes. You just might learn something here.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: What the hell's his problem?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Don't worry about it.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: It's just that I left my asshole decoder ring at home, so how do I know not to worry?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You need to get a haircut.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: And some new clothes.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: We're going to rope this banker tomorrow and you gotta at least look classy, if not be classy. You gotta do this thing and I don't even know if you can.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: You're just going to have to trust me.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I don't trust anyone.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Then show me how.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Uh... Everything okay?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Honey, this is Mr. Lewis. Carolyn Lewis's father. Mr. Lewis, this is my wife, Lily.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: He's gone.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: I gotta go get a haircut.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You just put a mother of a jinx on us.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Lighten up.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: But the fucking Grand Poo-Bah of all jinxes? A bird in your house...

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: You told me to change my hair!

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What about this? Do you have any idea what this means? You've killed us. We're dead!

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Did I miss something?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: We're getting down to the wire. Apparently another company has a similar product in R&D right now. If they beat us to it...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Off the record, I'm this close to cutting someone in on the action if it'd help.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Look at you... You want to go.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: For what? A couple hundred bucks?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: I think you'd do it for free. You're almost drooling. You like the rush.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: It's what I do. It's my job.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Why? Your mother not breast feed you or something?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Are you asking me if I have something to prove?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Do you have something to prove?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Not in that repressed anger sort of way.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: I'm your basic underachiever. Can't stand working and porn doesn't seem like a good option.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Good quality porn has it's place in the world.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Whatever. But you... I get the feeling you could have bullshitted your way into anything. So why this?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'm good at it. Lying, cheating, manipulating... I'm good at it.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: It's more than that.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Intuition. It doesn't make you Yoda. Like tonight. You killed that guy tonight. But I knew you would.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: So that was my part? Smile and shake my ass?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No. You have another part? You'll know what to do.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: How do you know I will?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Intuition.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: You have really soft hands. Like a baby's.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Don't ruin this for me.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: How do you deal with --

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: WHAT?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I SAID, HOW DO --  Deal with that?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Who says you have to know the King to be in a hole? I actually did have a real job once. When I was in high school, I worked as a candy striper.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Sounds respectable.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Not the way I did it. I was loaded half the time. I don't know how you could change bedpans sober. I used to hang out with this guy, Glenn. He was an x-ray technician or something.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You want to talk about an old boyfriend right now?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: He wasn't my boyfriend. I had a boyfriend at the time... What was his name? Anyway, Glenn was like thirty. I was only fifteen. But he was a nice guy. Real sweet. Liked to talk. We used to get loaded on pills from the nurses station and then listen to Morrisey or some stupid shit like that.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Yeah, the sensitive guy-thing never worked for me.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: We were friends. I trusted him. I should have known it was weird. But, then again I was weird.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You guys got busted. This is a great neck.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: No, we never got busted. We were done with a shift one night, both a couple of Percocets down and I was telling Glenn about my boyfriend, about how we were thinking about doing it, you know? I was thinking about letting him be my first because I loved him.  What the hell was his name?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Glenn talked you out of it.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Sort of. I was telling him about this great love of my life who's name I don't remember, and I could see... He was getting pissed. I thought it was just because he was worried about me, but... He told me that I was stupid because my boyfriend didn't really love me.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: He was looking out for you.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Then he grabbed me and threw me down on the floor, that really cold linoleum tiled hospital floor and started ripping my uniform off.  He said he was going to "fuck some sense into me."

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Shit, what was that guy's name? I really liked him.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Lily... Jesus Christ...

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: After Glenn was finished, he gave me a couple of valiums and I went home. The next day, I finished my shift and met him around back, like we always did. I stuck a number eight scalpel into his chest. Three or four times.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Did, uh... Did you kill him?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: I don't know. I packed up my shit and ran away. To this... So unlike you, I guess I do have something to prove, in a repressed anger sort of way.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No. You trusted him... You were just getting square.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: You know why I told you that, Jake?  Because I trust you too.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Jesus... Take it easy.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: No, I'm not going to take it easy. You can't stay clear of this guy. He will be on this until the end of time.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: You are such a raving pussy sometimes.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Hey, we fucked once, honey. That hardly makes you a good judge of character. And don't think I didn't know you were working some angle with that either.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Everyone's working an angle, right?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: There are three people I trust -- him, him and a guy who got killed. I don't know who you are! You're like some stray dog that wandered into the house. So I'm telling you to cut loose of this. No one's looking for you, Not the King, not Moonan and not Gillette. Just go wherever it is you would go. It's over.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: What about...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What about what?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: What about the money?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: So there it is. You got that big itch you need to scratch. It's all about the fucking money. What do you want, an apology?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: No, I want my cut!

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I'm going to say this one last time for you, so take a deep breath and count to ten. There is no cut.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Sorry. I didn't know...

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Your friend, Big Al? It should have been you.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: You got my cell. Leave a message.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: It's me. It's Jake. Listen... It's happening. Gordo's landing right now. Meet me at the Euclid... For your cut, I mean. It's... I want you to have it.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What do you get, Lily? Finder's Fee? Because it is all about the money, right?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: You sold me out. You should have trusted me like I trusted you. You fucked up. You fucked up HUGE.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: You tell them the "Tale".

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: What do you want? An apology?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: No, I want my cut!

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Tick-tock...

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: If you wanna help, then help. If not, shut up.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Your mess.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Then shut up.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: My place.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Stop waving that thing around.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: You sure we're clear?
